result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin Lee Haase

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for 11/21/22 @ 2:30 p.m. in Br 1

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal controlled substances. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment. 
No contact with victim 1, R.R.D.
Take all medications as prescribed
May go to the premises one time, accompanied by law enforcement, to retrieve personal belongings & medication.

1:10 PM Defendant Kevin L Haase appeared by video, in custody.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of WI. 

Attorney Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of Misdemeanor Battery, Disorderly Conduct, Felony Intimidation of a Victim - Domestic Abuse Enhancer. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.
Court questions defendant. 
Defendant is informed that he can petition the court for a court appointed attorney.
State is in compliance with victim rights notification.
Victim is present but does not wish to be heard.

State requests a $750 signature bond with conditions as stated. 

Attorney for the defendant does not have any objections as to bond.
Court adopts the requested $750 signature bond with conditions as stated on the record. 

Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
